skills.skillDesc: I've been self-studying front-end development for a while now, and I've managed to get a very good understanding of HTML5, though I know web development won't stop growing, so I won't stop learning.
I've managed to get a very good grasp of CSS over the past few months. I am happy with the progress I've made, but I'm still learning as much as I can to improve my skills.

I've gained experience using JavaScript by building a few projects, which allowed me to grasp key concepts. I am still in the process of improving my knowledge regarding JS. I'm quite happy with the progress I'm making.
During my 6 months at Life Choices, I learned how to use GitHub and now have a good understanding of the commands we were taught. I can now use GitHub with my eyes closed.

I'm currently improving my skills with Vue, some of the concepts comes easy me to when I apply the code but some I need a bit more time to give over though the determination succeed helps me to overcome those obstacles

During my 6 months at Life Choices Coding Academy, we created an e-commerce website and we used node js as our backend language. During the project, I've managed to build a good understanding of node js and how to build an API, I've also managed to get a good understanding of authenticate and authorization.
I've used mysql for my ecommerce backend database. I've been using SQL for quite some time so I know my way around it and a few SQL queries.

education.eduDesc: I'm currently attending a 12-month coding bootcamp at Life Choices, which will prepare me to become a web developer. I'm learning all the necessary skills to thrive as a front-end developer.
Rlabs had a one month program where we were introduced to AWS and how it all works.

Rlabs created a one-year program where they taught us different concepts in IT. We were taught how to use the Microsoft Suite and how to write emails in the workplace. After 3 months, they split us up into groups depending on what job you wanted. I chose web development, so throughout the year we were taught web development concepts and created web pages using WordPress.

This is where I started my journey into the world of Information technology. During my two and a half years at iStudent Academy, I gained knowledge that would help me in the workplace. The qualifications I obtained are the following: 1. National Certification: Information Technology, Systems Development 2. Diploma: ICT Systems and Principles for IT Professionals and 3. National Certification: Information Technology, Systems Support

In 2016, I joined a month-long short course with Rlabs as an introduction to web development, and this is where my passion came about. I was exposed to HTML and CSS and created basic webpages, but the feeling I got when I created a webpage is one I won't ever forget.
My high school period wasn't the best but I'm proud of the person I become after I graduated.

qualification.qualification: Microsoft Certified: Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals

work.jobDesc: Sintrex is an IT infrastructure management company that creates applications for clients. The clients that we create help companies monitor their IT infrastructure, such as networking equipment and their workstations.

I worked at Business Technology for 9 months as a Systems engineer, and my daily tasks were as follows: seeing to client hardware and software issues; doing client visits; and setting up PCs for clients. The reason I left was because I felt like it wasn't what I wanted to do and needed to do something else.

I worked at First Technology for 5 months, and my daily tasks were creating power apps and power flows for clients, seeing to clients SharePoint Sites, and creating custom SharePoint sites. The reason I left was because I felt like I wasn't ready and needed to study further.

projects.projectDesc: This is my attempt at recreating a website I found on pinterest.

projects.projectTitle: BMX E-com Website / HTML / CSS / VUE / Node.js / MYSQL
projects.projectDesc: The goal of this project was to improve on my backend developement as well as to create a complete ecommerce website which included a register and login process. It also showcases my skills using a REST API and mysql as my database for the website. You can view the backend and frontend code via the GitHub link, there are 2 branches, one for the backend and one for the frontend. You will need to switch between the branches to see the code for each file.

I created an e-commerce website with an admin page using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The primary objective was to build a functional and visually appealing online store with an accompanying admin interface to manage products using a CRUD system.
I created this website for someone I know, they sell things from their home and wanted a website to post their items. I am still busy with the website and will be adding more features to the website.

I found a property website design on Pinterest and tried recreating it using HTML and CSS. The goal was to develop a visually appealing and user-friendly website that showcases various properties and provides essential information to potential buyers or renters.

I did the same process as with the property website, where I looked for website designs to recreate to test my HTML and CSS skills. I found a travel website that peaked my interest, and I've recreated the website to the best of my ability.

testimonials.name: Summer De Wet
testimonials.textFirst: Justin is the most intellectually intelligent person I know, if I could say so my self.He is extremely helpful and is always willing to leave his work to help anyone in need. He has such a kind spirit. For the past few weeks, Justin has become a really close friend of mine, and his help
testimonials.textSecond: and presence have greatly benefited me. I appreciate it. Justin does extremely well with his work and pays attention to detail in whatever he does. So I assure you, Justin would be a perfect candidate and make any company prosper! Justin doesn't mean 'righteous' for nothing.

testimonials.name: Rabia Haucha
testimonials.textFirst: Justin is a very considerate and helpful young man who is very pleasant to work with. His energy alone is like a sudden beam of sunlight, illuminating the darkest corners of the room and adding happiness to everyone's day. He is hardworking, never fails to complete any given task,
testimonials.textSecond: and helps anyone who needs it. Having him in your workplace will be an asset because he is a quick thinker and a very hard worker.

testimonials.name: Zia Khan
testimonials.textFirst: I truly admire Justin's amazing work ethic. He is highly skilled at what he does. When I met him, I immediately picked up on the fact that he is an intelligent person. He is great at working with others. He's very good at problem solving and thinking creatively; he is always willing to help others,
testimonials.textSecond: and he can be super dependable. He can be very organized and shows amazing support for others.

testimonials.name: Jason Viljoen
testimonials.textFirst: Justin is a truly promising student, showing potential in all areas of this course. Being one of his fellow classmates, I could only gain as much knowledge from him as I could. He constantly has new ideas and is very innovative when in the development sector. He is able to work in both the back-end
testimonials.textSecond: and front-end sectors due to his knack for problem solving and always doing his utmost to solve any problem that arises. Justin is extremely intuitive and a quick thinker; no challenge is too hard for Justin Scholtz.

testimonials.name: Codi Kader
testimonials.textFirst: Justin, He is a very determined, passionate and kind young man. He is going to do great things in the IT sector. You can count on that. Justin strives his best to make sure that all his deadlines & work is done as soon as possible and correctly as possible. He works really well in a group or alone.
testimonials.textSecond: He is able to adapt in any environment he is placed in. Once you get to know him you feel a sense of belonging as he is able to welcome you in with a warm and kind energy.

testimonials.name: Mujahid Fisher
testimonials.textFirst: Justin is one of the funniest and smartest person I know. He is truly a people's person. He is someone who is willing and ready to lend a helping hand. He is never afraid of asking the right questions.
testimonials.textSecond: So if you looking for someone who has the best qualities, personality and brains he should be your first option, TRUST ME!

aboutMe.title: Adobe Photoshop
aboutMe.desc: During 2016 I had some free time to learn a new skill and I decided to learn how to use photoshop, I managed to get a good understanding of how it works and how to create graphics for certain things.

aboutMe.title: Adobe Illstrator
aboutMe.desc: Adobe illstrator was the next program I learned which I really enjoyed as typography always caught my eye.

aboutMe.title: Abobe After Effects
aboutMe.desc: I wanted to create videos and I came across Adobe After Effects, it was a really fun experience learning to create or edit videos.

aboutMe.title: Gaming
aboutMe.desc: Huge soccer fan, if I'm not watching soccer then I'm playing soccer with friends. You'd always catch me with a ball because I grew up with one.

aboutMe.title: Sports
aboutMe.desc: Huge soccer fan, if I'm not watching soccer then I'm playing soccer with friends. You'd always catch me with a ball because I grew up with one.

aboutMe.title: Hands On Experience
aboutMe.desc: I like breaking things and then fixing them, since a child I've been breaking lots of things which is where my passion for breaking things came from. I love building things no matter how small the project.
